C45374E70C9E446D8488EF2A351A05C8.description:
evaluate the quality of own
contributions to group process, and
offer constructive feedback to
others; propose suggestions for
improvement

F5FE990643424E17B894C51E911CBF43.description:
organize and complete tasks
cooperatively by defining roles and
responsibilities, negotiating to find
the basis for agreement, setting
objectives and time frame, and
reviewing progress

74924BCB37F84A21A5887DC1CE23F4B3.description:
contribute ideas, knowledge and
strategies to identify group
information needs and sources

C8D9AF38C4F846BD811C033492827E2C.description:
use opportunities as a group
member to contribute to group
goals and extend own learning

C1CB18FBB8F64944BF585C6FF94BA59F.description:
propose ideas or advocate points of
view that recognize the ideas of
others and advance the thinking of
the group

08DF0D6D3A374DBFAFB1F2F16BDBC891.description:
use inclusive language and actions
that demonstrate respect for people
of different races, cultures,
genders, ages and abilities

7E1AC71C66304CE99A2F362FB9961A17.description:
participate in organizing and
celebrating special events,
recognizing the appropriateness
and significance of the language
arts

F67566494D564014AFD0DD885C9F14CF.description:
compare ways in which oral, print
and other media texts reflect
specific elements of cultures or
periods in history

1FC478C802EE40B58002C3F4FF5D7003.description:
clarify and broaden perspectives
and opinions, by examining the
ideas of others

6C6BB67FE9844706B099121283BD009D.description:
compare own with others’
understanding of people, cultural
traditions and values portrayed in
oral, print and other media texts

18E10A1C52704D9EA3366B89FDB28B84.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to respect, support and collaborate with others

18678079EA434958B57D4CCF8CE1934A.description:
use appropriate verbal and
nonverbal feedback to respond
respectfully

894C12DD7F9F49868A864751F4DB7A11.description:
anticipate the organizational
pattern of presentations, and
identify important ideas and
supporting details

197451F367084DFB9F31E23388867A21.description:
plan and shape presentations to
achieve particular purposes or
effects, and use feedback from
rehearsals to make modifications

8DBE2BD13C9E445F952EC133BFD9F499.description:
Use effective oral and visual
communication

33318039693540D6B55AA9F1F3627380.description:
present information to achieve a
particular purpose and to appeal to
interest and background knowledge
of reader or audience

F130AE8BA5B84A318F67E78D57C3C1FF.description:
plan and facilitate small group and
short, whole class presentations to
share information

DEEE8067EDDD4E7E8483BF305424D6F4.description:
use appropriate capitalization and
punctuation for referencing oral,
print and other media texts

78B8DC7736594F75AEFB887EA327B106.description:
use parentheses appropriately in
own writing

3C612B67D2144CD68CEE9605B3C852EE.description:
identify semicolons, dashes and
hyphens when reading, and use
them to assist comprehension

7704181979D5402C95BDD9D148AB351B.description:
use hyphens to break words at the
end of lines, and to make a new
word from two related words in
own writing

C6D044D1E3D841EF986CFB2A412F45BC.description:
identify the use of spelling variants
in print and other media texts, and
discuss the effectiveness depending
on audience and purpose

C1272BE7F8144F1BA932F97CDC92A6ED.description:
develop a systematic and effective
approach to studying and
remembering the correct spelling of
key words encountered in a variety
of print and other media texts

7C99DE925A53462B977ACEBC48903B90.description:
use knowledge of spelling
generalizations and how words are
formed to spell technical terms and
unfamiliar words in own writing

15F8681B74A64247A6F8047A7FA4EC19.description:
use verb tenses consistently
throughout a piece of writing

11174E18A90F437A9762B6B619838D6C.description:
use correct pronoun–antecedent
agreement in own writing

7EFDB9714E4B4D41803FEBCC6181986E.description:
use a variety of simple, compound
and complex sentence structures to
communicate effectively, and to
make writing interesting

3CB8907077184910B7914A8CA916970A.description:
use words and phrases to modify,
clarify and enhance ideas and
descriptions in own writing

7451CAF3728D4A73B5E9DDB5F28966F8.description:
experiment with figurative
language, voice, sentence patterns,
camera angle and music to create
an impression or mood

EFE69B63A1334CA9B2EC6E972CE2FF4D.description:
infer the literal and figurative
meaning of words in context, using
idioms, analogies, metaphors and
similes

AE26ABE3074D4CCBB88A09AF0A1B2FF4.description:
explore and explain ways that new
words, phrases and manners of
expression enter the language as a
result of factors, such as popular
culture, technology, other
languages

96E555D800CC4303B7CC2BE962502A33.description:
choose an effective format for
documents, depending on the
content, audience and purpose

FDE5FC23538C4EF2B28555453CBA9748.description:
vary handwriting style and pace,
depending on the context, audience
and purpose

5906303A34E64FFE82A80F711BD1459A.description:
use paragraph structures to
demonstrate unity and coherence

3E4D52EBDB0C489E909BBEDBBAA50819.description:
enhance the coherence and impact
of documents, using electronic
editing functions

E60BFD3F932849CCA9850206C6D2E77A.description:
revise to enhance sentence variety,
word choice and appropriate tone

833C2B07C73742A5BEF1B8B68F29B7AB.description:
revise by adding words and phrases
that emphasize important ideas or
create dominant impressions

97B21E5279F946D7B3F44B29BD63F436.description:
evaluate how particular content
features contribute to, or detract
from, the overall effectiveness of
own and others’ oral, print and
other media texts; make and
suggest revisions

EAFD69B4D5D44AE78C1143AAF47766F5.description:
share draft oral, print and other
media texts in a way that will elicit
useful feedback

1DD6ED88DA564C958D7E94E3AEF33994.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to enhance the clarity and artistry of communication

1B36CA3FFCDF4A17A09B6B4613971566.description:
assess the research process, and
consider alternative ways of
achieving research goals

C8075527FCF5489C985E558AE0F5DD25.description:
integrate appropriate visual, print
and/or other media to inform and
engage the audience

4EBF97C0946A4E92BB1C5F77F59913FF.description:
communicate ideas and
information in a variety of oral,
print and other media texts, such as
interviews, minilessons and
documentaries

09DD5AF9671F46A593CFE2B4797C6351.description:
incorporate new information with
prior knowledge and experiences to
develop new understanding

5F03043031144136949C72EE33CDFBC8.description:
evaluate the relevance and
importance of gathered
information; address information
gaps

CF79EC2CD05342909296DF2796914A3A.description:
use a consistent and approved
format to give credit for quoted and
paraphrased ideas and information

21820B32B8174BB8A64270F0CA6843A0.description:
discard information that is
irrelevant for audience, purpose,
form or point of view

2D5665A676B54C0E8FBA3E03501F1642.description:
make notes in point form,
summarizing major ideas and
supporting details; reference
sources

38B4BE6BB28F49A5A9531C977781F7DA.description:
organize ideas and information to
establish an overall impression or
point of view in oral, print and
other media texts

023F1E21FA6348F8BA7A67C28DF64526.description:
organize ideas and information
creatively, as well as logically, to
develop a comparison or
chronology, or to show a
cause–effect relationship

97A9A68B9F634ED0A129153FCB50ECFB.description:
develop and use criteria for
evaluating the usefulness, currency
and reliability of information for a
particular research project

62EE8C4FAF7C48848C464833BE6A75BD.description:
adjust rate of reading or viewing to
suit purpose and density of
information in print or other media
texts

B14D01C79D3E434FBB62B309BEF72008.description:
record key ideas and information
from oral, print and other media
texts, avoiding overuse of direct
quotations

05A27989A0314773A137A31241740563.description:
expand and use a variety of tools
and text features, such as subtitles,
margin notes, key words, electronic
searches, previews, reviews, visual
effects and sound effects, to access
information

27E97B43ACA4409EB15D597478F3A95E.description:
obtain information from a variety
of sources, such as artifacts,
debates, forums, biographies,
autobiographies, surveys,
documentaries, films, CDROMs,
charts and tables, when conducting
research

CBD8B23023D0412CADCF931A884E7EFA.description:
choose a plan to access, gather and
record information, according to
self-selected parameters

5BE91EC22AD940A5BBEA7624B6F652A1.description:
select the most appropriate
information sources for topic,
audience, purpose and form

0789346517DC466E879FFE08B2519378.description:
identify and trace the development
of arguments, opinions or points of
view in oral, print and other media
texts

E278EF0384304BDAA397A134463F910F.description:
experiment with several ways to
focus a topic, and select a form
appropriate to audience and
purpose

57C4AF16E68C4AA889EE86E5BFE404A9.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to manage ideas and information

09B24E69BD954D36904F50EE4E4D18F7.description:
choose forms or genres of oral,
print or other media texts for the
particular effects they will have on
audiences and purposes

9B7CD46F451A441EB08F2020320C89AC.description:
create oral, print and other media
texts with both main and minor
characters

BB6ECB62A2C447298FF5522C81919CFC.description:
retell oral, print and other media
texts from different points of view

C0E1FF3D062F47FA97DD6147F929C89B.description: Elaborate on the expression of ideas

7F0FC91AF03E40018BB5673B45EBBB33.description:
create oral, print and other media
texts related to issues encountered
in texts and in own life

58C39A6AEC164F9990BF75B102297093.description:
identify creative uses of language
and visuals in popular culture, such
as commercials, rock videos and
magazines; explain how imagery
and figurative language, such as
hyperbole, create tone and mood

FF6D6417881B41E78F319E826BA07E5B.description:
summarize the content of media
texts, and discuss the choices made
in planning and producing them

BE7B010B557440AD9C373F963130D5D3.description:
compare and contrast the different
perspectives provided by first and
third person narration

7F356C04D71A4360A7F0B61235EBB425.description:
identify and explain characters’
qualities and motivations, by
considering their words and
actions, their interactions with
other characters and the author’s or
narrator’s perspective

02D800DB9B144995AAF9853FF2E87B8B.description:
distinguish theme from topic or
main idea in oral, print and other
media texts

3BC7B5117543477D845033BA6DD60FD7.description:
compare the usefulness of different
types of media texts

5A456CF483784B48968219925EA88A45.description:
discuss how the choice of form or
genre of oral, print and other media
texts is appropriate to purpose and
audience

2A43469F05E64263AF1B77BF5B1C5080.description:
identify and discuss how word
choice and order, figurative
language, plot, setting and
character work together to create
mood and tone

7162933214FD4AC994A8AB618914FFD0.description:
identify ways that characters can be
developed, and discuss how
character, plot and setting are
interconnected and mutually
supportive

9F9D36CA7DC848348BBBB2179D876669.description:
discuss how techniques, such as
word choice, balance, camera
angles, line and framing,
communicate meaning and enhance
effects in oral, print and other
media texts

B84D7144142E4147A6197BA509328EFE.description:
compare two similar oral, print or
other media texts by considering
the characters, plot, conflicts and
main ideas

3B79233B994A45C1B79C61BCE1B4A169.description:
discuss various ways characters are
developed and the reasons for and
plausibility of character change

751A32924CFD440194EAED4455471026.description:
identify and describe characters’
attributes and motivations, using
evidence from the text and personal
experiences

128AE0F8D15B4D2ABD9323D67C005E7C.description:
interpret the choices and motives of
characters portrayed in oral, print
and other media texts, and examine
how they relate to self and others

2189E33777234B598D7116FD94C7D53E.description:
make connections between
biographical information about
authors, illustrators, storytellers
and filmmakers and their texts

38926F2D86A74934951194B6EBB1EB35.description:
explain connections between own
interpretation and information in
texts, and infer how texts will
influence others

F579AEB4342D42E582A9A6F8DAE3A855.description:
expect that there is more than one
interpretation for oral, print and
other media texts, and discuss other
points of view

088DBC10C16D47078B694409057C77ED.description:
write and represent narratives from
other points of view

5545564E87CA468FA6F40475A2CA44F6.description:
experience oral, print and other
media texts from a variety of
cultural traditions and genres, such
as magazine articles, diaries,
drama, poetry, Internet passages,
fantasy, nonfiction, advertisements
and photographs

86C326653375412592733AB0B64A7F9B.description:
use a thesaurus to extend
vocabulary and locate appropriate
words that express particular
aspects of meaning

669E9781BB194235B5CBF78FAADC319A.description:
choose and use strategies for word
identification, vocabulary
development and spelling that build
on specific strengths or address
areas for improvement

272058006BB84A9C8B30CF5C1181A1D2.description:
identify and use structural features
of a variety of oral, print and other
media texts, such as newspapers,
magazines, instruction booklets,
advertisements and schedules,
encountered in everyday life

83ED5EC137B44D4EA86B6C5C8951647D.description:
identify and use visual and textual
cues in reference materials, such as
catalogues, databases, web sites,
thesauri and writers’ handbooks, to
access information effectively and
efficiently

F48D45B04B924718800F96420F812B1B.description:
take notes, make outlines and use
strategies such as read, recite,
review to comprehend and
remember ideas and information

606837C823E74505B5E6019EE17783B4.description:
monitor understanding; skim, scan
or read slowly and carefully, as
appropriate, to enhance
comprehension

845FCAC78B0743CFBE28A51E67191885.description:
enhance understanding by
paraphrasing main ideas and
supporting details, and by
rereading and discussing relevant
passages

D71F868A388D43D584F9A71D1B152DB8.description:
use knowledge of authors, forms
and genres, developed during
previous reading, to direct and
extend reading experiences

5E7EE7301EC645B69D8AF30B131F1598.description:
use strategies to supplement and
extend prior knowledge and
experience when interpreting new
ideas and information

5547E43DE53D491396D6ABE006C1E1FB.description:
Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to comprehend and respond personally and critically
to oral, print and other media texts

3C7ACF0BD018413DB31C8BAEE832A307.description:
reconsider and revise initial
understandings and responses in
light of new ideas, information and
feedback from others

FDD87D6C92BD40D6A893123CA500A2D7.description:
exchange ideas and opinions to
clarify understanding and to
broaden personal perspectives

A0B0213192BA438CB14693C79E5B1AB3.description:
acknowledge the value of others’
ideas and opinions in exploring and
extending personal interpretations
and perspectives

CDD58116CA3F480F8DAAE93DD530A80D.description:
examine and reflect on own growth
in effective use of language to
revise and extend personal goals

0001DA7FA84E42B393C9E46E631C6615.description:
pursue personal interest in specific
genres by particular writers, artists,
storytellers and filmmakers

D6523CAC47B14B15AD933ED08FC2B2A6.description:
discuss and respond to ways that
forms of oral, print and other media
texts enhance or constrain the
development and communication
of ideas, information and
experiences

E6C3279AFB4D4940B7F2103C8ED52724.description:
seek out and consider diverse
ideas, opinions and experiences to
develop and extend own ideas,
opinions and experiences

FF128A99EA6044D5AE07433312445DC8.description:
review, reread and reflect on oral,
print and other media texts to
explore, confirm or revise
understanding

7383859F55C34C5291C0FB06CB465489.description:
revise understanding and
expression of ideas by connecting
new and prior knowledge and
experiences

09C42CBBF0B743BEBDE72C0087B60753.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to explore thoughts, ideas, feelings and experiences
